stxplore 0.0.0.9000
  • Articles
    Exploration using dataframes Exploration using stars objects
  • Reference

    Function reference

    All functions

    NOAA_df_1990
    National oceanic and atmospheric administration (NOAA) data from 1990 to 1993
    SSTdatashort
    The data from of the Sea Surface Temperature (SST) dataset. A subset of the original dataset is used.
    SSTlandmaskshort
    The land mask for the Sea Surface Temperature (SST) dataset. A subset of the original dataset is used.
    SSTlonlatshort
    The locations of the Sea Surface Temperatures (SST) dataset. A subset of the original dataset is used.
    Times
    The time period in which the NOAA dataset was recorded. This spans from January 1990 to December 1993.
    Tmax
    The maximum temperature values used in the NOAA dataset in a wide dataframe format.
    aerosol_australia
    Data from of NASA Earth Observations at https://neo.gsfc.nasa.gov
    aerosol_world
    Data from of NASA Earth Observations at https://neo.gsfc.nasa.gov
    autoplot(<cancor>)
    Plots Canonical Correlation Analysis variables from cannonical_correlation function.
    autoplot(<cancoreof>)
    Plots Canonical Correlation Analysis from cancor_eof function.
    autoplot(<emporthfun>)
    Plots empirical orthogonal function from emp_orth_fun
    autoplot(<hovmoller>)
    Hovmoller plots for latitude or longitude
    autoplot(<semivariogramobj>)
    Plots the semi-variogram computed from the semivariogram algorithm
    autoplot(<spatialcov>)
    Plots empirical spatial covariance using emp_spatial_cov function
    autoplot(<spatialmeans>)
    Plots spatial empirical means computed from spatial_means function
    autoplot(<temporalmeans>)
    Plots temporal empirical means computed from temporal_means function
    cancor_eof()
    Generic function to perform Canonical Correlation Analysis using Empirical Orthogonal Functions from a lagged dataset
    cancor_eof(<data.frame>)
    Performs Canonical Correlation Analysis using Empirical Orthogonal Functions from a lagged dataset using a dataframe
    cancor_eof(<stars>)
    Performs Canonical Correlation Analysis using Empirical Orthogonal Functions from a lagged dataset using a stars object
    canonical_correlation()
    Generic function to computes transformed variables from Canonical Correlation Analysis
    canonical_correlation(<data.frame>)
    Computes transformed variables from Canonical Correlation Analysis using a dataframe
    canonical_correlation(<stars>)
    Computes transformed variables from Canonical Correlation Analysis using a stars object
    emp_orth_fun()
    Computes empirical orthogonal functions
    emp_orth_fun(<data.frame>)
    Computes empirical orthogonal functions using a dataframe
    emp_orth_fun(<stars>)
    Computes empirical orthogonal functions for a stars object
    emp_spatial_cov()
    Generic function to compute empirical spatial covariance
    emp_spatial_cov(<data.frame>)
    Computes empirical spatial covariance using a dataframe as input
    emp_spatial_cov(<stars>)
    Computes empirical spatial covariance using a stars object
    hovmoller()
    Generic function to compute the data structure for Hovmoller plots
    hovmoller(<data.frame>)
    Computes the data structure for the Hovmoller plots using a dataframe as input
    hovmoller(<stars>)
    Computes the data structure for the Hovmoller plots using a stars object as input
    locs
    The locations used in the NOAA dataset.
    ridgeline()
    Generic function for ridgeline plots grouped by an attribute.
    ridgeline(<data.frame>)
    Ridgeline plots grouped by an attribute using a dataframe as an input.
    ridgeline(<stars>)
    Ridgeline plots grouped by an attribute using a stars object as input.
    semivariogram()
    Generic function to compute the semi-variogram
    semivariogram(<data.frame>)
    Computes the semi-variogram using a dataframe as input
    semivariogram(<stars>)
    Computes the semi-variogram using a stars object
    spatial_means()
    Generic function to compute spatial empirical means
    spatial_means(<data.frame>)
    Computes spatial empirical means using a dataframe as input
    spatial_means(<stars>)
    Computes spatial empirical means using a stars object as input
    spatial_snapshots()
    Generic function to plot spatial snapshots of data through time
    spatial_snapshots(<data.frame>)
    Plots spatial snapshots of data through time using a dataframe as input.
    spatial_snapshots(<stars>)
    Plots spatial snapshots of data through time using a stars object as input.
    temporal_means()
    Generic function to compute temporal empirical means
    temporal_means(<data.frame>)
    Computes temporal empirical means using a dataframe as input
    temporal_means(<stars>)
    Computes temporal empirical means using a stars object as input
    temporal_snapshots()
    Generic function to plot temporal snapshots of data for specific spatial locations
    temporal_snapshots(<data.frame>)
    Plots temporal snapshots of data for specific spatial locations using a dataframe as input.
    temporal_snapshots(<stars>)
    Plots temporal snapshots of data for specific spatial locations using a stars object as input.

    Developed by Sevvandi Kandanaarachchi, Petra Kunhert.

    Site built with pkgdown 2.0.7.
